vocabinfos.lsjDefs:
Λάζαρος, -ου, ὁ
colloquial abbreviation of Ἐλεαζάρ (άζαρος), which see),
Lazarus;
__1. of Bethany: Jhn.11:1 ff. Jhn.12:1-2, 9-10 12:17.
__2. The beggar in the parable: Luk.16:20, 23-25.†
(From Abbott-Smith. LSJ has no entry)
vocabinfos.mediumDef: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Luk.16.20
vocabinfos._es_Definition: Lázaro: (1) hermano de María y Marta ; (2) el mendigo en una parábola
vocabinfos._zh_tw_Definition:
拉撒路 这个陽性專有名詞在希伯來文的意思是 "神所幫助的人" (希伯來人名Eleazar的一種寫法)
1) 住在伯大尼,耶穌喜愛的一個人,也使他從死裡復活
2) 耶穌在#路 16:20-25|提到的一個窮人
vocabinfos._zh_Definition:
拉撒路这个阳性专有名词在希伯来文的意思是"神所帮助的人" (希伯来人名Eleazar的一种写法)
1) 住在伯大尼,耶稣喜爱的一个人,也使他从死里复活
2) 耶稣在#路16:20-25|提到的一个穷人

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Jhn.11.1;
brother of: Martha (G3136) and Mary (G3137J)

vocabinfos.shortDef: father of Lazarus, "one whom God helps"
vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of the New Testament, inferred at Luk.10.39;
unnamed father of: Martha (G3136), Mary (G3137J) and Lazarus (G2976H)
